results.title: Artists and artisans at Orrefors
results.brief_description: Artists and artisans at work in the Orrefors glass-works in Sweden. We see how they design their work, how they find aesthetic and practical solutions to functional problems, and all stages of the blowing of glass. Artists hand-paint designs onto glass, then they hand-engrave the design to complete the article. Many fine examples of Orrefors glassware are included. No credits available.

results.title: Artistic expression
results.creator_credit: Sandra Ostertag, Holt, Rinehart and Winston, CBS, KOCE-TV (Television station : Huntington Beach, Calif.) and Coast Community Colleges
results.brief_description:
Episode number 18 of Series “The Photographic vision”.
Overviews the artisitic expression of two innovative photographers, Nathan Lyons and Susan Rankaitis. The curator of the George Eastman House discusses the highly individualistic images produced by these photographers.

results.title: Artist: unknown
results.brief_description:
Being a struggling artist is tough at the best of times but when you’re thousands of miles from home, your debts are mounting and you’re making no money, something’s got to give.
Amy made the long trip from Australia to London to paint. The rent on her workspace is now a month overdue, the landlord is knocking and working part-time in a cafe is not making ends meet. She could try selling her work - but that would entail showing people.
Shot on location in London with original music by Horse Stories. Produced, directed and written by Catherine Green.

results.title: Artist at work: five British sculptors work and talk (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Warren Forma and Forma Arts Associates
results.brief_description: Shows five British sculptors as they work in their studios and discuss their achievements: Barbara Hepworth, who made the centerpiece for the exterior circle of the United Nations Headquarters in New York; Kenneth Armitage, who made “Mouton sun” for Chateau Mouton Rothschild; Lyn Chadwick, who won first prize in 1959 at Padua; Reg Butler, who won grand prize for his monument of the unknown political prisoner in 1953; Henry Moore, who completed the centerpieces for the Lincoln Centre for the Performing Arts in New York.

results.title: Artisans of Australia (Captioned)
results.brief_description: This video is an intimate view of traditional building and restoration techniques through the eyes of master craftsmen and women. It reveals rare skills which are fast disappearing in this rapidly changing world. The film has six sections each examining an individual craft: timbercraft, stonecraft, glasscraft, ironcraft, solid plastering and decorative paint work.

results.title: Artisans of Australia
results.creator_credit: Paul Humfress, Pamela Paddon and Film Australia
results.brief_description: A four part tape that features master stonemason George Proudmen, moulder Jack Thomas, stained glass artist Kevin Little and axemen Bill Boyd and Mark Gardner at work during conservation and restoration work on National Estate places such as Coolamine Homestead, Garrison Holy Trinity Church and the Sydney Technical College at Ultimo.

results.title: Artimus and old laces
results.brief_description: An important concept, the distributive principle, is illustrated in this animated tale about the multiplication problems of Cyrus Squeeze, tax collector. His niece Louise helps out by picturing each problem as areas or rectangular arrays, which she then adds up for the final product. No other credits available.

results.title: Artificial respiration by the H N Method
results.creator_credit: Svend Aage Lorentz and Danish Red Cross
results.brief_description: This film demonstrates the method of artificial respiration developed by Holger Nielson. The two basic movements of each cycle are the back pressure and arm lift. Application for adults is demonstrated and the modifications necessary for use on children are also shown.

results.title: Artificial jewellery from Neugablonz
results.brief_description: The history of the town of Neugablonz and the processes of the manufacture of artificial jewellery, and the training of workers in the industry.
